Text.Text: What th - damn it, they've broken into the tower!  I *knew* we should have taken the battle to them instead of hiding in here like frightened children!  Nathaniel - take out the ones in front, we'll use their bodies to block the door!  Now!
Enough of your lies, you half-breed dog!  No orc crosses me and lives!
Enough of your lies, dark elf!  Your life was forfeit as soon as you attacked Kuldahar!
This half-breed filth *saved* you, Nathaniel?  If so, I wouldn't waste my arrows on it - what have you to say for yourself, dog?  Does the druid speak true?
This treacherous elf *saved* you, Nathaniel?  If so, it was done only to betray you later; it is the way of their kind.  You - dark elf - does the druid speak true?
So - you're that group of sell-swords from the Ten-Towns we've heard so much about.  Based on Nathaniel's tales, I expected something more.  So, have you come to help us or not?
*We don't need your help, half-breed.*  If you're so anxious to help, why don't you try to carve a path to Iselore - if you survive the undead in the Pass, that is.

Maybe you didn't hear me, half-breed, but I just *did.*  If you'd rather talk than fight, then drag your filthy hide over to Iselore.  He seems to tolerate all manner of half-breed trash, even those with orcish blood.
*Sure* you did - we don't need your aid, dark elf.  If you're so anxious to help, why don't you try to carve a path to Iselore - if you survive the undead in the Pass, that is.

Really?  Maybe you didn't hear me, dark elf, but I just *did.*  If you're so anxious to talk rather than fight, why don't you drag your black hide over to Iselore?  You and he should have a lot to talk about where elves are concerned.
Through the Pass, to the east.  Past the mill or the bridge - either way, it doesn't matter.  Now *get out.*
Don't *speak* for me, Nathaniel.  *I'm* in charge here - if they come to aid Kuldahar, then let them go see Iselore!  I'll have nothing to do with them!

We'll see.  I'm the only member of the Kuldahar militia left in the Pass - well, except Nathaniel here, but he doesn't seem to be able to do much more than tell tales about your exploits.  I'm Jermsy - I'm in charge here.

Hired help is better than none at all, I suppose.  I'm the only member of the Kuldahar militia left in the Pass - well, except Nathaniel here, but he doesn't seem to be able to do much than tell tales about your exploits.  I'm Jermsy - I'm in charge here.

I think the Legion is more of a threat to Kuldahar than Ten-Towns - there's barely any of us left.  I'm the only member of the Kuldahar militia in the Pass - well, except Nathaniel here, but he doesn't seem to be able to do much than tell tales about your exploits.  I'm Jermsy - I'm in charge here.
We've been trapped in this damn tower even since that Legion priest started raising the dead in Hrothgar's Glen.  I wanted to hunt him down, but Nathaniel told us we should wait for you.
You sure took your time getting here, I thought we'd be overrun for sure.
Yeah, I do - the coward's fled back to his cave inside Hrothgar's Glen - it's to the north, past the great gate.
Wait - you *met* the Banite?  What did he want?

The bastard's been digging up graves in the Glen, then raising the corpses and sending them out to kill anyone they find.  Now he's having them tear apart the Pass, trying to provoke Iselore into leaving the Heartstone Gem.
Well, he seems to have found a way *around* it, Nathaniel.  If the rest of his troops get out of there, we're dead - we can barely hold the tower as it is!

Just open the damned gate, Nathaniel!  If they want to carry the battle to him, then *let* them.  We can't sit here and wait for him to slaughter the rest of us - and Iselore has his hands full with defending the Heartstone Gem from the yuan-ti!
Some help these "heroes" are, Nathaniel - I knew you were exaggerating their exploits in the Western Pass.  Let them run off to Iselore - we'll be no worse off than we were before they arrived.

"Darker purpose?"  By the Gods, Nathaniel, are you blind?  We're cut off from the town and knee-deep in Kuldahar's dead!  Rein your cryptic babbling and either make yourself useful or hold your tongue.  You make me wish you'd gone to Kuldahar instead of Gerbash - at least *he* knows how to use a crossbow.
You're back.  What do you want?
What is it?

I can't *believe* it - Nathaniel was telling the truth about you.  That priest... dead, *finally.*  Here, take these - they're some items we had stored away in case we had to leave the tower.  Thanks to you, we don't need them now, and besides, you've earned them.

Yes - we had to, to warn them of the undead.  Iselore, the archdruid, is supposed to be protecting the Heartstone Gem in the center of town to the east, but we haven't seen him for days - though Nathaniel *claims* he still lives.  Sheemish and Old Man Conlan are probably still there, too, but we don't know for sure.

We sent Gerbash, the innkeeper of the Evening Shade, out a few nights ago to see if he could warn the rest of the town about the undead, or, with Tymora's blessing, perhaps even escape Kuldahar and go for help - but we haven't heard from him since he left.  Dammit - *I* should have gone, not him.

Even worse, Gerbash was carrying the key to the watchtower - if that falls into yuan-ti hands or the hands of that Banite in the Glen, you won't be the only visitors coming through the front door.  Without this tower, we might as well surrender the Pass entirely.

Look, if you happen to make your way to Kuldahar and back here, let me know if you turn up any sign of Gerbash.  If he's alive, then more fortune to us - if not, then we need that key back, or we'll be joining him.
I see - thanks for finding him and getting the key back.  At least I know we can hold the tower if more of the Legion strikes Kuldahar.

Dammit, I knew I should have gone, but he was so *mule-headed* about it - in any event, you have my thanks for retrieving the key.  At least I know we can hold the tower if more of the Legion strikes Kuldahar.
I forgot Nathaniel said you were *mercenaries.*  Look, I paid you all I have when you killed that priest - if you don't want to help us now, then get out of here.

I forgot Nathaniel said you were *mercenaries.*  Look, I can pay you - but not until that Banite priest and all his troops are dead.  If you'd rather not fight him, then fine - but you won't see a coin from me, sell-sword.

They're father and son, and at last word, they were still in Kuldahar - neither of them is worth a copper in a fight, though.  Conlan used to run the town smithy until his senses started to dull around the edges.  Sheemish was the captive of the yuan-ti when he was a kid... same time my family was killed by a band of orcs.  You'd think he would have left by now, but he stays.

*Yes,* they did.  Killed my father and my sister, right in the mill to the northeast of here.  I hid in the basement during the attack - I heard my family begging for mercy, then listened to the orcs tear apart our home brick by brick looking for gold.  Anything *else* you want to know?

Well, this part of the Pass used to be nothing more than a few small farms, my family's mill, and the watchtower here.  Kuldahar lies to the east - you can find Iselore and the Heartstone Gem there.  And of course, Hrothgar's Glen is to the north, past the great gate.

There's almost nothing left; most of the residents fled, leaving their homes boarded up behind them - the town's almost dead now.  If you're expecting a hero's welcome, you're going to be disappointed.

If that wasn't enough, the yuan-ti from Dragon's Eye prowl the outskirts, hacking into the roots of the great oak, trying to lure Iselore away from the Heartstone Gem.  This "Legion of the Chimera" are nothing but cowards - they don't seem to have the spine for a stand-up fight.

In case it *escaped* you while getting here, the Pass is crawling with undead that damn Banite priest is raising.  If that wasn't the worst of it, the yuan-ti from Dragon's Eye have surrounded the main town of Kuldahar itself.  There's nowhere to run - for you or us.

Well, after you dealt with Hiepherus and his troops, the Pass is clear now - now our only troubles are with the yuan-ti.  They've surrounded the main town of Kuldahar itself.  There's nowhere to run - for you or us.

Snake-men from Dragon's Eye - they've had a bloody history with Kuldahar, dating all the way back to the time when me and Sheemish were children.  We should've wiped them out years ago, but Iselore held us back.  Now half the town is dead, and we're next.
They were just looking for an opportunity - chances are, the Legion of the Chimera came to them and suggested an alliance, and they leaped at the chance.  Now, we're under siege from all sides.

Not much.  I spent a lot of time in the old temple of Ilmater when I was young.  I hear they lived in that burned-out house in the western edge of the Pass - they were being raised by Mother Egenia, at least until the two of them murdered her.

That's the story, not that there were many witnesses - if at all.  Ask Nathaniel about it, if you want to know more.  He used to live here in the Pass next to Mother Egenia before her house was destroyed by the villagers.
Iselore's the archdruid.  Been here for about twenty to thirty years - he *should* have driven the yuan-ti out of Dragon's Eye as soon as he arrived, and now we're paying the price.
Still, he's refused to abandon the town, I give him that - but whether that's because of the Heartstone Gem or the people of Kuldahar, I don't know.

If you haven't spoken to him already, he *should* be east of here, guarding the Heartstone Gem from the yuan-ti - if he isn't dead already.  If you want to know more about him, ask Nathaniel - he taught Nathaniel all he knows, which would explain why we're cowering here in this tower.
Hrothgar?  Some adventurer from Easthaven.  He and a band of adventurers came through the pass to help Kuldahar thirty years ago.
Most of them died in an avalanche caused by frost giants - their bodies are buried in the graveyard now, or were, before that damned priest raised them from the dead.
I have to keep watch for *enemies,* not over your sleeping bodies.  Ask Nathaniel to do it - it'll make him useful.

It's good to see you well - we haven't had any more yuan-ti attacks, I think you may have them on the run.  We've been able to seal up the watchtower and actually hole up here in Kuldahar, thank the Gods - that tower... and Nathaniel's ill omens... were driving me mad.

Look - we got off on the wrong foot when you first arrived, and I wanted to... apologize.  There was no reason for me to lose my temper with you - especially considering how much you've risked for Kuldahar.
Get away from me - I hope the North swallows your corpses.
Hold on!  We've come with Oswald!  Don't fire!
Hold on!  We've come with Oswald!  Don't fire!
Hold on!  We've come with Oswald!  Don't fire!
We're not your enemies - lower your weapons!
We're not your enemies - lower your weapons!
We're not your enemies - lower your weapons!
If a single arrow flies, you'll be dead before the second shot.  We're here to help you.
If a single arrow flies, you'll be dead before the second shot.  We're here to help you.
If a single arrow flies, you'll be dead before the second shot.  We're here to help you.
We mean no harm to you, or Kuldahar.  We came here from the Ten-Towns to help.
Watch your tongue.  The Ten-Towns hired us to help defeat the Legion.  We came to assist you.
We do *not* take orders from you, and no one *dares* talk to me that way.
We mean no harm to you, or Kuldahar.  We came here from the Ten-Towns to help.
Watch your tongue.  The Ten-Towns hired us to help defeat the Legion.  We came to assist you.
We do *not* take orders from you, and no one *dares* talk to me that way.
Yes, we've come to help you.
We've come to help ourselves.  Mercenary coin flows freely in the Ten-Towns.
We're here to deal with the Legion threat to the Ten-Towns, if that is what you mean.
I will.  Where can I find him?
Fine.  Where is he?
No one *dares* talk to me that way.
Then tell me where Iselore is, and I'll be on my way.
I'll seek him out, then.  Maybe then I'll come back and we'll trade more than words.
I will.  Where can I find him?
Fine.  Where is he?
No one *dares* talk to me that way, and we do *not* take orders from you.
I will.  Where can I find him?
Fine.  Where is he?
I'll seek him out, then.  Maybe then I'll come back and we'll trade more than words.
We've met that priest you mentioned, but he vanished before we could stop him.  Do you know where he went?
Traveling through the Underdark can take time - not to mention being threatened by a priest of Bane on our arrival.  Sorry if our troubles have *inconvenienced* you.
He is no *true* priest of Bane - he needs me only to lay him low before Bane punishes him in death.  I only need to know where he is, and I will see to it he is dealt with.
Only to deliver threats.  Do you know where he is now?
Open the gate, and I will put an end to this blasphemer who claims to serve Bane.
We will gain nothing by waiting for the priest to strike again.  Open the gate, and we will stop this priest.
I didn't ask *your* opinion, ranger - I was speaking to Nathaniel.
If that is a challenge, then very well.  Open the gate to the Glen, and we will stop this priest.
Perhaps we should handle it - especially if those in charge have proven useless.  We'll take care of this priest - open the gate.
We will defeat this priest if *need* be, but not now.  There's greater threats to be dealt with first.
You sent someone to Kuldahar?
I defeated Hiepherus and all his troops.  The Pass and Hrothgar's Glen should be clear now.
I defeated Hiepherus and all his troops.  The Pass and Hrothgar's Glen should be clear now.
I defeated Hiepherus and all his troops.  The Pass and Hrothgar's Glen should be clear now.
We found Gerbash - and retrieved the watchtower key.
I found the watchtower key Gerbash was carrying, but he didn't make it.
Do you know who still lives in Kuldahar?
Can you tell me about Kuldahar Pass?
What's happening here?
What's happening here?
You mentioned Hrothgar's Glen.  Who is Hrothgar?
What can you tell me about Iselore?
Do you know anything about Isair and Madae?
Can you tell me about Sheemish and Conlan?
Can you watch over us while we rest?
Nothing at the moment.  Farewell.
I defeated Hiepherus and all his troops.  The Pass and Hrothgar's Glen should be clear now.
I defeated Hiepherus and all his troops.  The Pass and Hrothgar's Glen should be clear now.
I defeated Hiepherus and all his troops.  The Pass and Hrothgar's Glen should be clear now.
We found Gerbash - and retrieved the watchtower key.
I found the watchtower key Gerbash was carrying, but he didn't make it.
Do you know who still lives in Kuldahar?
Can you tell me about Kuldahar Pass?
What's happening here?
What's happening here?
You mentioned Hrothgar's Glen.  Who is Hrothgar?
What can you tell me about Iselore?
Do you know anything about Isair and Madae?
Can you tell me about Sheemish and Conlan?
Can you watch over us while we rest?
Nothing at the moment.  Farewell.
Keep your items, Jermsy - I wished to help you, and Kuldahar may need them in the days to come.  I had some questions, instead.
The tenets of my order prevent me from accepting your reward, Jermsy - the gesture is appreciated, but not necessary.  I had some questions, instead.
Thank you.  We'll try to make good use of these - but first, I had some questions I wished to ask.
This should help in the days to come.  Farewell, Jermsy.
No reward is necessary, Jermsy - we were pleased we could help.  Farewell.
No reward is necessary, Jermsy - Kuldahar may need them in the days to come.  Farewell.
Gerbash lives, and here is the key.
I found the watchtower key Gerbash was carrying, but he didn't make it.
If I can, I will.  Who are Sheemish and Conlan?
I had some questions for you, first.
If I come across him, I'll let you know.  Farewell.
Your thanks is appreciated, but we went to some trouble to retrieve that key - and would like to be paid for our effort.
Your thanks is appreciated, but we went to some trouble to retrieve that key - and would like to be paid for our effort.
It was no trouble.  I had some questions for you.
I hope so.  Farewell.
Your thanks is appreciated, but we went to some trouble to retrieve that key - and would like to be paid for our effort.
Your thanks is appreciated, but we went to some trouble to retrieve that key - and would like to be paid for our effort.
It was no trouble.  I had some questions for you.
I hope so.  Farewell.
Very well.  I had some questions for you.
Then we have nothing more to discuss.  Farewell.
I already defeated Hiepherus and all his troops.  The Pass and Hrothgar's Glen should be clear now.
I already defeated Hiepherus and all his troops.  The Pass and Hrothgar's Glen should be clear now.
I already defeated Hiepherus and all his troops.  The Pass and Hrothgar's Glen should be clear now.
Very well.  I had some questions for you.
Then we have nothing more to discuss.  Farewell.
Orcs killed your family?
I see.  I had some questions for you.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
I mourn your loss.  Can I ask you something else?
Yes... I had some other questions for you.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
What's in Kuldahar?
I see.  I had some questions for you.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
The yuan-ti?
I see.  I had some questions for you.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
I defeated Hiepherus and all his troops.  The Pass and Hrothgar's Glen should be clear now.
I defeated Hiepherus and all his troops.  The Pass and Hrothgar's Glen should be clear now.
I defeated Hiepherus and all his troops.  The Pass and Hrothgar's Glen should be clear now.
The yuan-ti?
I see.  I had some questions for you.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
The yuan-ti?
I see.  I had some questions for you.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
Why have the yuan-ti attacked now?
I see.  I had some questions for you.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
I see.  I had some questions for you.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
They murdered her?
I see.  I had some questions for you.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
I see.  I had some questions for you.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
The yuan-ti?
I see.  I had some questions for you.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
I see.  I had some questions for you.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
Very well.  We had some other questions for you first.
We'll ask Nathaniel, then.  Farewell.
Hopefully, we can keep driving the Legion back until they no longer pose a threat to the North.
Don't blame Nathaniel - we druids are supposed to make cryptic pronouncements every once in a while.
I hope so - we'll see.  Farewell.
Hopefully, we can keep driving the Legion back until they no longer pose a threat to the North.
Don't blame Nathaniel - we druids are supposed to make cryptic pronouncements every once in a while.
I hope so - we'll see.  Farewell.
The matter is forgotten - do not trouble yourself about it.  For now, let us stand together against a common threat.
If you did not stand with Kuldahar, we would have cut you down, ranger.  Now leave us to our business.
You're forgiven.  Farewell, Jermsy.
You're forgiven.  Prejudice is very... human.  Farewell, Jermsy.
